title: Establishes the invest in New York and New York invests in you tuition reimbursement program
summary: Establishes the invest in New York and New York invests in you tuition reimbursement program; establishes a personal income tax credit for one-half of the student loan expenses paid by a taxpayer during the taxable year for the 10 years following graduation from the state university of New York or the city university of New York when the taxpayer continues to reside and work in the state following graduation.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the

       AN ACT to amend the education law and the tax law, in  relation  to  the
         invest  in  New York and New York invests in you tuition reimbursement
         program

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The education law is amended by adding a new article 14-B
    2  to read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE 14-B
    4                           INVEST IN NEW YORK AND
    5                           NEW YORK INVESTS IN YOU
    6  SECTION 696. INVEST IN NEW YORK AND NEW  YORK  INVESTS  IN  YOU  TUITION
    7                  REIMBURSEMENT PROGRAM.
    8    S  696.  INVEST  IN  NEW  YORK  AND  NEW  YORK  INVESTS IN YOU TUITION
    9  REIMBURSEMENT PROGRAM. 1. THERE IS HEREBY ESTABLISHED AN INVEST  IN  NEW
   10  YORK  AND  NEW  YORK  INVESTS IN YOU TUITION REIMBURSEMENT PROGRAM. SUCH
   11  PROGRAM SHALL  ESTABLISH  A  PERSONAL  INCOME  TAX  DEDUCTION  EQUAL  TO
   12  ONE-HALF  OF  THE STUDENT LOAN EXPENSE PAID DURING EACH TAXABLE YEAR FOR
   13  THE TEN YEARS IMMEDIATELY  FOLLOWING  GRADUATION  FROM  ANY  COLLEGE  OR
   14  UNIVERSITY OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK OR THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF
   15  NEW  YORK.  SUCH TAX DEDUCTION SHALL APPLY ONLY TO PERSONS WHO ARE RESI-
   16  DENTS OF THE STATE AND ARE EMPLOYED IN THE STATE FOLLOWING GRADUATION.
   17    2. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "STUDENT LOAN EXPENSE" SHALL MEAN
   18  THE CUMULATIVE TOTAL OF THE ANNUAL STUDENT LOANS COVERING  THE  COST  OF
   19  ATTENDANCE AT AN UNDERGRADUATE AND/OR GRADUATE COLLEGE AND/OR UNIVERSITY
   20  OF  THE  STATE  UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK AND/OR THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW
   21  YORK, AND ANY INTEREST THEREON.
   22    3. THE COMMISSIONER AND THE COMMISSIONER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE SHALL
   23  JOINTLY PROMULGATE ALL RULES AND REGULATIONS NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT  THE
   24  PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    6    S 3. This act shall take effect on the first of January next  succeed-
    7  ing  the  date  on  which  it shall have become a law; provided that any
    8  rules and regulations necessary to implement the provisions of this  act
    9  on  its effective date are authorized and directed to be promulgated and
   10  completed on or before such date.
